metadata.Description: Biochar is a type of charcoal produced from biomass that is used as a soil amendment.

level 1.Description: Biochar addresses soil fertility by improving nutrient retention and enhancing soil structure.
Biochar employs the process of pyrolysis to convert biomass into a stable carbon-rich product that can be used as a soil amendment.
Biochar collaborates with agricultural organizations to promote the use of biochar as a sustainable soil amendment.
Biochar supports carbon sequestration by capturing and storing carbon in the soil for long periods of time.
Biochar administers biochar production facilities to ensure the quality and availability of biochar for agricultural use.
Biochar measures soil pH to determine the optimal application rate of biochar for different soil types.
Biochar aligns with circular economy principles by converting agricultural waste into a valuable resource for soil improvement.
Biochar is an instance of carbon sequestration technology that utilizes biomass to capture and store carbon in the soil.
